headline: No-Yeast Pizza Crust
description: This no-yeast pizza dough is quick and easy to make without hours of waiting for the dough to rise. Add your favorite pizza toppings for a fun meal!
name: No-Yeast Pizza Crust

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl; stir in milk and olive oil until a soft dough forms. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead 10 times. Shape dough into a ball; cover with an inverted bowl and let sit for 10 minutes.
Roll dough into a 12-inch circle on a baking sheet.

review.reviewBody: Quick and easy

This was decent/edible, but yâ€™all, itâ€™s not a pizza crust. Itâ€™s a big, flat biscuit. Itâ€™s probably not possible to make a pizza crust without yeast, so thatâ€™s on me for seeking the recipe out. Just manage your expectations. :) (It might work for a breakfast-style â€˜pizzaâ€™?)

This came out perfect! I put it directly on the rack when it was done for a little crisp. I used real milk because itâ€™s my first time making it and wanted to follow instructions but Iâ€™m curious if almond milk would work the same since I donâ€™t ever buy cows milk. I also took the suggestion of someone else review and added seasoning to the crust.

I first tried this recipe in desperation on a day when I promised my family pizza for dinner before realizing that I was out of yeast. We all loved it so much that I made it twice more that week. I recommended it to some friends with milk-allergic kids and they love it too. Highly recommended! I use whole milk and garlic-infused avocado oil, because those are what I keep on hand.
Super yummy. And super simple

The crust turned out pretty good, I can't reflect on the taste because I added spices to it(which turned out good) but the crust held together, was easy to shape, and the crust rose as it should, overall pretty good.

I have used this recipe a few times now and have found it to be quick, simple and actually quite tasty. I guess you get the best end product with the best ingredients. I didnâ€™t add anything extra except maybe a little more salt and virgin olive oil. Tasted awesome. Thanks from the UKðŸ‘

It tasted like cardboard to us. My husband asked me to never make this recipe again. Sorry... it needs some flavor, like maybe garlic or basil... I used all our favorite toppings, but we ended up scraping the toppings off and eating them without the crust.

First left my 5-start review on this in Nov 24 2020, and I've been making this once every week or two since. The crust holds together well even when spread thin, and can be easily spiced up with a little red pepper, garlic salt, or parmesan mixed in.
Great recipe, I added half whole wheat and half white flour then omitted the oil and added dried oregano, basil, and garlic powder. Very good, family loved it!
This recipe is easy and fast. I turned the pizza dough into Breadsticks, with a little bit of garlic powder. SO GOOD!!
Was nice and quick
It tasted like bisquick dough. Not very flavorful. Maybe if you double up on salt? I tried both pre-baking and putting toppings on raw dough and it was still just 'ok' both ways.
This was a great recipe! Well done!
I made it into bread.

Probably should have read this one a little better, but I had a hankering for pizza and I work at a cheese factory, with all this fresh shredded cheese I had, I decided Pizza was needed. Added some garlic powder (with nondescript spices) and threw it all together. Didn't read the part where it suggested the kneading and the resting, Also ignored the section where it wanted you to blind bake the crust.... perhaps it would have been less... Dusty? The crust crumbled like shortbread, but hey, it was pizza with loads of cheese, sauce, and cubed ham, could not possibly go wrong, ate the whole thing.
Amazing!! I personally like thin pizza crust but either way it will be delicious ðŸ˜‹ and the fact that you can adjust the amount of servings it just perfect 3 â­ï¸
The dough was dry, so I kept adding milk. It was about 3 tablespoons more. I doubled the recipe and made it into four individual pizzas!
I loved how the crust turned out I think next time I'll add herbs to the crust. Can't wait to make it with my son and see how he likes it.
I made this tonight. Very good! Light and Crispy crust. Topped it with homemade tomato sauce, artichoke hearts, salami, mushrooms, red pepper and mozza! A real hit and very fast and easy!
I made this crust, and not only was it simple, but it tasted amazing.
Great recipe, I went to make dough and didn't have yeast. This worked great I broke it in to 3 smaller ones and air fried them. Yum
very bready, alright taste, the best of what Iâ€™d expect from a no-yeast dough.

I use red pepper infused olive oil And for topings a mixture of ground beef and ground sausage with Italian seasoning mushrooms and shredded cheese it is awesome Ps brush some garlic butter on crust before first bake
This is a great recipe. It rolls out very thin, which I like. Very easy to make. I followed the recipe exactly and it tasted like some of the crusts I have had in Italy.
Tasted fine. It got really crunchy. The pizza kind of fell apart. I wouldn't make it again. Was disappointed. Not sure what I did wrong. I'll stick to pizza crust mix.

I live in vegas and itâ€™s impossible To find any good pizza here Iâ€™m from Chicago where pizza is king so I decided to make my own pizza. I just recently found out that I have issues with yeast so I decided to make a yeast free dough. This dough was perfect, not only do they stand up to being very thin and have sausage and lots of cheese on it but it didnâ€™t bend or break and I love how crispy the crust came out. I was able to get two pizzas because I rolled it so then.

I didn't have fat-free milk so I used what I had. It was really good at first! But after awhile the baking soda really took over. So, I think next time, I might half the baking soda so it doesn't give it a weird soda taste. But I'd still recommend anyone to try it!
I think it was awsome
Easy plain pizza dough for when you are in a hurry.

I'm very inexperienced with making my own pizza. This recipe has been a life changer for me! I use GF all purpose flour and oat milk one for one and it still comes out great! My kids love it too. No more frozen pizzas for us
Iâ€™ve made this a few times now and absolutely love it! Easy to make and tastes amazing!
This was very east and delicious! I will definitely use this recipe again!!
This isn't really pizza crust. It is more of a bread texture. 4 stars as a flatbread type "pizza" Also, I added Italian seasoning, garlic salt, pepper and it was still a little bland.
Ended up adding 1/4 teaspoon of garlic salt and olive oil to crust it baked for the 8 minutes and in a deep dish rectangular pan. SO good!!??
Success! This was so easy and turned out so well that I didn't change a thing and had a perfect pizza! I love it!
I love this recipe, thank you so much for sharing! Its bookmarked for life!!
This is my go to recipe . Its good
It was amazing. I made some for my little brother who I was babysitting and he loved it!
OK im only 11 i love to cook and i made this for dinner in under an hour

I didnâ€™t have yeast nor self rising flour so i was looking for a recipe that did not call for neither. This was the perfect ratio i needed. I added 1/2 teaspoon of dried italian seasonings to the dry ingredients and 1/2 teaspoon to the wet ingredients heated up the salt (cut back that a little cause of the sodium and used low sodium baking powder also only had homogenized milk but all the ratios were the same. Seems like a great ratioâ€¦.hope the kids donâ€™t mind i put seasonings lol but thanks for the recipe.
it was good
dough came out super sticky gave up halfway thru
This recipe was easy and yielded tasty results! It will be a keeper in our house!

It was difficult to get yeast for a while so we had to change our style. This is a tasty alternative...if you add a few things. We add 1.5 TBSP Oregano and the same amount of Parmesan cheese to the crust when we first mix the dry ingredients. Otherwise it is too plain for us.
Not as good as a yeasted dough but will do in a pinch. Thought it was kind of bland even tho I added a pinch of salt to the dough.
Pretty good recipe because I didnâ€™t have any yeast. I like the way the crust held up. I wish I could get the middle as crispy as the edges, I love thin crust pizza. Thank You!!!

This is the only recipe I use to make pizza crust. It is sooo easy! I will say it can be a little bland as suggested. I always add in garlic powder and oregano. Sometimes I add onion powder, cayenne, or red pepper flakes. Often after rolling out the dough before putting on the sauce I will brush on some melted butter with garlic powder and oregano to give it more flavor. This wonâ€™t rise much as it doesnâ€™t have yeast but Iâ€™m a thin crust lover most of the time. I love it!
This crust is really quite good and very easy. I'll make it again, and in fact will probably never buy another frozen pizza because of it.
I added rosemary to the dough which gave it a fantastic taste! This was so easy to make!

Good quick no yeast crust. I suggest adding the lil xtra milk because as written it was very dry. Even rolled very thin for a 14" pan I would def double the recipe. Great quick dinner right now mix tho! TY for the post!
Love this dough but never used for pizza only quiche and calzone. But we love crust on both these and Iâ€™m not a crust eater!

I upped the servings to 12 and I'm happy with that size, it about covered my baking sheet. I added a little flour and used a rolling pin to roll it out and I highly recommend that, the last time I made it I didn't have a rolling pin and the crust ended up biscuity. I also added rosemary, I had some leftovers from a different recipe, and that was good too!! 

Just make sure you put enough sauce on it. It's a little dry without enough sauce. 

I love it because it's SO quick and it's hard to come by yeast during a pandemic!

This recipe is perfect for dinners. It has become a regular dish for me to make. 

A few modifications:
I add 2-3 teaspoons of various italian seasonings and garlic powder to the dough for flavor, Ive also found that I need to double the recipe to feed four people.

No disrespect to the author, but this is NOT " pizza crust". More like "biscuit with toppings" I made this following directions to a T and it was barely serviceable. In the future, if I want pizza I'm either going to make actual dough or buy some at the store. This was pretty much a fail, sorry.

I had to make my daughter dinner in a hurry and I thought Iâ€™d look up an easy pizza crust. I was very happy with the results. I didnâ€™t have much on hand so I just sprayed the pan with vegetable spray and rolled out the crust and pinched up the sides. I put tomato sauce, some Parmesan cheese, then chili flakes and topped it with shredded cheese and a few big drops of ricotta, which I spread around once it started baking. When it came out of the oven I lightly salted and peppered it. My daughter came back from her room and said I donâ€™t know what you did to that pizza but it was great. She liked the nice thin crust.
Love this recipe!! So quick and easy! I added a little extra milk and some Italian seasoning and i am so excited to try it this way.
Fast, easy, and perfect crunchy edges.. I added a clove of garlic and 1/4 tsp of dried basil. Will for sure be using this recipe again.
Turned out really good will use again

I used spelt flour in place of wheat flour and almond milk in place of dairy milk. Plus I kneaded Kerrygold Irish butter into it as I worked it. It was sooooo good, and friendly to my food sensitivities.

This is such a delicious, quick, and easy crust! My pepperoni-and-cheese pizza lovers love it, and my cinnamon-and-sugar-dessert pizza lover loves it, too! I need to triple the recipe to make three pizzas for our family of four.

This was an amazing recipe!! I really loved it and so did the rest of my family!
The only thing I would say is that it worked better for me when I only added 1 tbs of olive oil rather than two, but, otherwise it was perfect!!
this was great easy to make,my wife and kids loved it
Nice quick and really tasty
We use it every time we want pizza!
Double the recipe and add a egg wash and butter to the crust!

This recipe was incredible !! The crust came together so easily, didn't need to roll in flour at all !! I only had to use 1 cup of flour for it to form the dough.

Personally, I added cheese, alfredo sauce, basil, green onions and crushed red pepper. It was amazing, tasted and looked like something from a restaurant. I definitely recommend this recipe and this is the only pizza dough I will be using.

Awwww me and my hubby enjoyed our first homemade pizza. We followed all the measurements and it tastes so good. Currently we are in a lockdown, theres no oven in the place we are staying, so we made our pizza in a non stick pan. Thin crust indeed! Thank you for sharing.
I would not make it again. It was very easy to make but the crust ended up tasting like a large, flat biscuit. I think I'll go back to yeast.

Made this dough for some traditional Nova Scotia garlic fingers. PERFECT DOUGH 

Thanks!
I tried this Pizza and it came out wonderful! This is an easy but tasty pizza recipie!
It's my go to, never fails. Excellent, excellent, excellent!
The fiancÃ© and I really enjoyed it! Precooked dough for 7 min and then baked for 17 1/2min. Came out perfect. Nice thin, crispy crust.
LOVED it!
I didnâ€™t have fat free milk, I only had 2%, and I baked it at 425Â° on a pizza stone. It came out perfect! One of the better crusts that I have made. Iâ€™ll definitely be using this recipe again

My family LOVES this recipe. We are missing our take out pizza, and are low on yeast, so decided to try this. I use a pizza stone, and pre-bake (with an olive oil and seasoning blend brushed on) for about 10 minutes before adding toppings. After adding toppings, another 20ish minutes - sometimes a brief go under the broiler to crisp the cheese. This one has been added to my permanent, hand written recipe box.

Quick and easy. Never made pizza dough before and this turned out great. Iâ€™m not sure of how many inches I spread it but I thought it was really thin and it rose to about 1/2â€ thickness. Iâ€™m pretty sure it wasnâ€™t 12â€ So next time, Iâ€™ll roll out thinner.
I would make it again
The best pizza dough ever. I used to make the pizza dough with only water and the result was a dry dough and difficult to knead. but this one way so moist and yummy. Thank you so much
my first time making something from scratch and honestly it was edible hahaha i dont know why my bread tasted a bit weird though, i followed instruction. well its my first time so that might be it
Great! Easy! Love it! Made it several times.
The recipe is good, no frills, easy recipe.

I love this recipe and will never buy store bought crust again. I ran out of yeast during COVID-19 and found this as a replacement. My family gobbled it up! Made it a few times as is with great results. Tonight, I doubled the recipe, added 1/4 cup parmesiano reggiano cheese and 1 and 1/2 TBL spoons of Italian seasoning. Wow! Try it! Made two pizzas and they were devoured! Thank you for sharing!

With the recipe and baker comments, I found a pretty good backup recipe for when we're out of yeast. I doubled the recipe and added 1tsp white sugar, 1 tbsp oregano, 1tsp minced garlic, and 1/2 tsp pepper. I rolled it on parchment and just slid the paper & dough onto the sheet pan to bake. Blind baked for 8 min, baked with toppings for 8-10min. We split this into 4 and everyone made their own personal pizza.
Perfect! Yes!! I will make it again.

I only cooked the crust for 5 minutes instead of 8 for the first cooking, and then 12 minutes for the second with all ingredients. Came out beautiful, different ovens probably cook differently, but we love this thin crispy crust!

Excellent recipe when you can't find yeast in this Covid-19 world. 

I didn't bake this as directed before putting on the toppings. Big mistake as the top got a little browner than I would have liked in order to get the bottom of the crust browned sufficiently.

I multiplied the recipe by 5 to make a meal for our large family. As I always do, I added a heaping tablespoon of minced garlic, about three teaspoons of dried oregano, a healthy pinch of crushed red pepper, and a bit of extra salt. The dough is easy to make and easy to work with while forming the pizzas. Most of the pizzas we rolled very thin--almost to the point of tearing--and baked for just ten minutes on the second bake. This gave us a very crispy crust. (It was brittle in the thinnest parts.) We liked it, but will probably bake only 5-8 minutes on the second bake next time. We made a couple of pizzas thicker and the result was biscuit-like. I didn't like it as much, but I topped one with a few eggs cracked whole onto the crust (like a breakfast tart w/butter pastry); it was pretty tasty and would probably make a good breakfast pizza. I still prefer a yeast dough, but rolled thin, this is a terrific quick and easy substitute recipe if you cannot eat yeast or don't have it on hand.
We love this one!
As a splash of water if to sticky. But I really enjoy this crust. Nice alternative to a yeast crust.

I have been searching for a recipe for pizza dough that does not have yeast in it. This one is easy and delicious! I made my own pizza sauce and topped it with our favorite ingredients. This will be my "go to" pizza dough recipe from now on.

Based on reviews, I added Italian Seasoning and oregano to the crust. It was still a bit flavourless, but with the pizza ingredients, it was ok. The crust itself seemed more like a cracker or pastry crust. But hey, it was good enough to eat so I'm grateful for the quick and easy recipe
Surprisingly great tasting! Made with spinach and red onion ..its a keeper!

Iâ€™ve made this recipe twice now, I split it into 2 and made flatbread pizzas. Itâ€™s so easy to come together, and I only had soy milk and it worked out perfectly! I agree with other comments, I didnâ€™t season the dough the first time but added garlic salt and dried oregano the second time and it was even better. Highly recommend this recipe!
this is a great recipe especially if you can't find yeast!

Thank you so much for this!! I rolled the dough out really thin, and it was absolutely delicious. I had tried 3 other no yeast recipes and they did not come out how i wanted it. This was perfect and I will never order out again for pizza.
Deelish!
Didn't care much for this recipe. Not really into biscuit pizza.
Super easy, great alternative when you have all the ingredients but no yeast.
